timeline.message: Function workers re-direct call update requests to the leader
Do not expose updateOnLeader to functions
Do leadership changes in function metadata manager
Added an option to compact function metadata topic

timeline.bodyText: Or should we just check if the message has a data or not?
timeline.author: jerrypeng

replies.bodyText:
actually prefer explicit setting.
Plus with this change, key is being set for whether you are compacting the topic or not
replies.author: srkukarni

replies.bodyText: Is there a way for a user to that is already using functions to be able to turn compaction on? Is there a path of migration for these users?
replies.author: jerrypeng
jerrypeng

replies.bodyText: The format of the messages are now different.
replies.author: srkukarni

replies.bodyText: Just the version is added as part of properties right?  We can still process the messages differently based on whether the data == null or not
replies.author: jerrypeng

replies.bodyText: Not just the version. We actually write function metadata when compaction is turned on. In case when it’s not compacted, we write the service request for backwards compatibility.
replies.author: srkukarni

timeline.bodyText: Given the current approach, this is a dangerous flag. If a user mistakenly flips the flag on.  It could render their cluster corrupt. We should perhaps add more warnings for what this config with do.  Instead of "compactMetadataTopic" maybe we can rename it to "useCompactedMetadataTopic"?  So that what it does is more clear.
timeline.author: jerrypeng

replies.bodyText: Will change the name. Although the possibility of corruption is low. Because before a leader can actually start writing, it needs to read all existing messages and the messages will not deserialize either way.
replies.author: srkukarni

replies.bodyText: I would suggest to add some more content to the doc annotation on what the impact of flipping the flag is.
replies.author: jerrypeng

timeline.bodyText:
lets use a
private const final String

variable for "version"
timeline.author: jerrypeng

timeline.bodyText: This will add a key for both the old format and new format right? Not sure we should add a key for the old format.  Perhaps, whether checking whether the message has a key or not can be used to determine whether its the old format or new format.
timeline.author: jerrypeng

timeline.bodyText: Should we change this check to if a key exists or not?  This creates an avenue in which a existing cluster can transition to use a compacted metadata topic
timeline.author: jerrypeng

replies.bodyText: I don't think thats a good idea. I would rather have worker fail here unless specifically configured to have compaction enabled or disabled.
replies.author: srkukarni
